page.title: 13CHURCH FARM CLUTTON
page.content: We interviewed Colin Withers about every day life on Church Farm. He told us that the farm was mentioned in the {Domesday Book}. He told us that his family had owned the farm for 30 years. They have 400 acres, 40 of which are rented. All of his family had worked on the farm. It was a family tradition. His father writes the cheques, his brother feeds the pigs and Colin and another man mostly look after the cows.He gets up at aout 5.45 and stops work at about 6p.m.,but later in the summer. His job is looking after the cows and milking them.He has 240 ewes and lambs. Colin thinks that to be a good farmer you have to be prepared to do things for them. He does not like it when animals die but it does not happen very often.
